description: Two storey side and rear extension (following demolition of existing part rear extension) associated with the conversion of the property into four self contained flats, provision of car parking, refuse and cycle parking and associated amenity space
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing number: C02/A received on 08/08/2013.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | All residential dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 7, policies 3.8 and 7.2 of The London Plan, and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved details of the refuse and recycling facility to include sections of the access ramp shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained in perpetuity.   Reason:  To ensure suitable loading, unloading and refuse collection arrangements are provided in order to ensure pedestrian and highway safety and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Notwithstanding the drawings submitted with this application, details of acoustic boundary treatment to be installed to the northern boundary shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site. Once approved the boundary treatment shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any of dwellings hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of the occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 7.15 of The London Plan, policy 1.1(j) the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Notwithstanding the drawings submitted with this application, details of the proposed boundary treatments and gates to the shared access  and to define the private amenity areas and parking areas shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site. They shall be provided as approved prior to the first occupation any of the dwellings hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter. 	 Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and in the interests of the amenities of occupiers of the proposed and existing housing in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment', and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The existing fruit trees in the rear garden shall be retained as part of the communal garden area for the upper floor flats and shall not be removed, or any work undertaken (other than for pruning to maintain the health and fruiting potential of these trees) except with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.   Reason : To safeguard these established trees which contribute towards the visual amenity and character of this residential area and to assist in screening the extended property from the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.21 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004), policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 7B of the draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The trees in the rear garden to be retained shall be enclosed prior to the commencement of any development on site by a 2.4 metre high fence which shall extend to the crown spread of the trees and the area so enclosed shall not be used for any purpose and the ground levels shall not be altered and this fence shall remain in place until all aspects of the development have been completed.   Reason : To safeguard the future of these trees that contribute towards the visual amenity and character of the area during the works to extend the building and form  car parking spaces in accordance with policy 7.21 of the adopted London Plan (2011), policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004) and policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
